Name: Macedonians
History: Macedonia was an ancient Greek kingdom, centered in the northeastern part of the Greek peninsula. Under the leadership of Alexander the Great, Macedonian forces and allies took over most of the world they knew, including Egypt, Persia and parts of the Indian subcontinent, allowing a diffusion of Hellenic and eastern cultures for years to come.

Factions.Name: Macedonians
Factions.Description: A Hellenistic kingdom bordering the Greek city-states.

Technologies.Name: Fetters Of Hellas
Technologies.History: The Antigonid Macedonians controlled some of the strongest and most valuable fortified locations in Greece for a long while.

Technologies.Name: Silver Shields Regiment
Technologies.History: In India near the end of his long anabasis, Alexander gifted to the Royal Hypaspist corps shields of silver for their long and valiant service in his army.
Technologies.Description: Upgrade Shield Bearer Champion Infantry to Silver Shields, with greater attack, health and armor.

Technologies.Name: Antigonid Reform
Technologies.History: The Antigonid kings ordered various military reforms including an increased focus on pikemen rearming them and enlisting Thracians in their ranks as well as the introduction of the deadly Kestros Dart Sling.
Technologies.Description: Pikemen train 20% faster and get +1 hack and pierce armor levels. Unlocks the Kestros Sling upgrade (to be enhanced by second reform).

Technologies.Name: Hellenistic Metropolises
Technologies.History: Beginning with Alexander, the Hellenistic monarchs founded many cities throughout their empires, where Greek culture and art blended with local customs to create the motley Hellenistic civilization.
Technologies.Description: Civic Centers have double Health and double default arrows.

Heroes.Name: Philip II of Macedon
Heroes.History: The king of Macedonia (359-336 B.C.), he carried out vast monetary and military reforms in order to make his kingdom the most powerful force in the Greek world. Greatly enlarged the size of Macedonia by conquering much of Thrace and subduing the Greeks. Murdered in Aegae while planning a campaign against Persia.

Heroes.Name: Alexander the Great
Heroes.History: The most powerful hero of them all - son of Philip II, king of Macedonia (336-323 B.C.). After conquering the rest of the Thracians and quelling the unrest of the Greeks, Alexander embarked on a world-conquest march. Defeating the Persian forces at Granicus (334 B.C.), Issus (333 B.C.) and Gaugamela (331 B.C.), he became master of the Persian Empire. Entering India, he defeated king Porus at Hydaspes (326 B.C.), but his weary troops made him halt. Died in Babylon at the age of 33 while planning a campaign against Arabia.

Heroes.Name: Demetrios the Besieger
Heroes.History: One of the Diadochi, king of Macedonia (294-288 B.C.), Demetrios was renowned as one of the bravest and most able successors of Alexander. As the son of Antigonus I Monophthalmus, he fought and won many important battles early on and was proclaimed king, along with his father, in 306 B.C. Losing his Asian possessions after the battle of Ipsos, he later won the Macedonian throne. Fearing lest they should be overpowered by Demetrios, the other Diadochi united against him and defeated him.

CivBonuses.Name: Horsemanship
CivBonuses.History: Unlike the Greek City-States, the Macedonians and their Thessalian and Thracian neighbours, who often provided them with military units, were great horsemen and fielded relatively large numbers of cavalry who were famed for their swiftness and thunderous charges.

CivBonuses.Name: Hardy Peltasts
CivBonuses.History: The northern balkan tribes provided skilled peltasts to the Macedonian army.

TeamBonuses.Name: Standardized Currency
TeamBonuses.History: The Macedonians and the Diadochi minted coins of very high quality. On their currency the Diadochi in particular frequently depicted themselves as the rightful successor to Alexander the Great, attempting to legitimize their rule.
TeamBonuses.Description: All units and structures -5% metal cost (currently not shared).

Structures.Name: Theatron
Structures.History: Greek theatres were places where the immortal tragedies of Aeschylus, Sophocles and many other talented dramatists were staged to the delight of the populace. They were instrumental in enriching Hellenic culture.
Structures.Special: The Hellenization civ bonus. Building a Theatron increases the territory effect of all buildings by 25%. Build limit: 1.

Structures.Name: Library
Structures.History: Alexander the Great founded libraries all over his new empire. These became a center of learning for an entirely new synthesized culture: the Hellenistic culture.
Structures.Special: All Special Technologies are researched here. Building one reduces the cost of all other remaining technologies by 10%. Build limit: 1.

Structures.Name: Siege Workshop
Structures.History: The Macedonians were innovators in area of siegecraft.
Structures.Special: Constructs and upgrades all Macedonian siege engines.
